org.vsplf.i18n
Interface Translator

All Known Implementing Classes:
I18NTranslator
public interface Translator

The Translator APIs to translate any message. This class must be used by client to have dynamic i18n and for automatic tool handling.

These APIs are inspired from ICU MessageFormat, Drupal's Locale APIs, gettext-commons APIs, GNU gettext APIs.

Sample code for client code: 

   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   t._("Hello World Out There!");

Since:
Feb 22, 2012
Author:
hoatle (hoatlevan at gmail dot com)
See Also:
(ICU) MessageFormat

Method Detail

_

String _(String messagePattern)
Translates a message pattern (simples string) with locale aware.
For example: 
   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   t._("Hello World");

Parameters:
messagePattern - the message pattern.
Returns:
the translated string.

_

String _(String messagePattern,
         Locale locale)
Translates a message pattern (simples string) with specified locale.
For example: 
   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   Locale vietnamese = new Locale("vi", "VN");
   t._("Hello World", vietnamese);

Parameters:
messagePattern - the message pattern.
locale - the specified locale.
Returns:
the translated string.

_

String _(String messagePattern,
         Object[] messageArguments)
Translates a message pattern with an array of message arguments (support numbered arguments) with locale aware.
For example: 
   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   t._("Hello {0}", new String[] {"VSPLF"});

Parameters:
messagePattern - the message pattern.
messageArguments - the array of message arguments.
Returns:
the translated string.

_

String _(String messagePattern,
         Object[] messageArguments,
         Locale locale)
Translates a message pattern with an array of message arguments (support numbered arguments) with a specified locale.
For example: 
   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   Locale vietnamese = new Locale("vi", "VN");
   t._("Hello {0}", new String[] {"VSPLF"}, vietnamese);

Parameters:
messagePattern - the message pattern.
messageArguments - the array of message arguments.
locale - the specified locale.
Returns:
the translated string.

_

String _(String messagePattern,
         Map<String,Object> messageArguments)
Translates a message pattern with a map of message arguments (support named arguments) with locale aware.
For example: 
   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   Map arguments = new HashMap();
   arguments.put("name", "VSPLF");
   t._("Hello {name}", arguments);

Parameters:
messagePattern - the message pattern.
messageArguments - the map of message arguments.
Returns:
the translated string.

_

String _(String messagePattern,
         Map<String,Object> messageArguments,
         Locale locale)
Translates a message pattern with a map of message arguments (support named arguments) with a specific locale.
For example: 
   Translator t = TranslatorFactory.getTranslator();
   Map arguments = new HashMap();
   arguments.put("name", "VSPLF");
   Locale vietnamese = new Locale("vi", "VN");
   t._("Hello {name}", arguments, vietnamese);

Parameters:
messagePattern - the message pattern.
messageArguments - the map of message arguments.
locale - the specified locale.
Returns:
the translated string.
